what: Setting up a project with prodigenr
title: Getting started with prodigenr
text: Starting research project? Create project directory like : via RStudio‚Äôs ‚ÄúNew Project‚Äù interface (RStudio version >1.1). resulting file structure look something like : README.md files contained within project folder explains bit folder file used , briefly described : R/: contain R scripts functions used analysis. docs/: contain files related presenting project‚Äôs scientific output. Already report/manuscript inside. data/: relevant, processed (simulated) data kept used project well results project‚Äôs analyses. data-raw/: relevant, scripts process raw data usable data kept , optionally raw data also kept. DESCRIPTION: standard file includes metadata project, machine readable format, also stores list R packages project depends . .Rproj: standard file used RStudio set R Project specific settings. add new document (e.g.¬†slides, manuscript), run create_*() commands (e.g.¬†create_slides()) console RStudio newly created project (via .Rproj file): Now two files added docs/ folder. resulting file structure look something like : present, two template files can view: template files academic researcher likely typically encounters. However, suggestion want add template, please create GitHub issue submit Pull Request! end goal project self contained possible. ever need go back analysis, easy re-run code get results say got. especially useful others reviewers ask something want confirm results. See manifesto details underlying philosophy behind package.

title: Getting started with prodigenr
text: several ways handling project. packages similar functionality prodigenr package structure: ProjectTemplate well documented still actively developed. downside fairly complicated use complex project workflow creates. makeProject simple stripped creates ‚Äôs use. Downside wasn‚Äôt updated since 2012. Use R package structure via devtools (usethis), argued blog compared ProjectTemplate blog). rrtools similar prodigenr, except focuses manuscripts. well thought documentation well written. workflowr workflow creating online, data science content. also list similar projects rOpenSci GitHub repository. ‚Äôs decide style use.

title: Research Project Directory Generator
text: package simple aim project directory generator (prodigenr), simple focus : Creating standardized project folder structure template files needed beginning data analysis project. Following ‚Äúone project, one (main) output‚Äù principle, report/manuscript case scientific output book website things like courses workshops. Adhering established best practices make easier project reproducible open. standardized approach scientific project structured helps ensure final code documents fairly modular, self-contained, easy share make public, reproducible possible. structure also makes use existing established applications workflows (RStudio, devtools, usethis).

title: Research Project Directory Generator
text: two ways creating new project: using R console using RStudio ‚ÄúNew Project‚Äù menu option. console, use setup_project() command. , instance, want manuscript project, type : creates directory tree, template files starting analysis! Open newly created project via .Rproj file. RStudio approach, go ‚ÄúFile -> New Project‚Äù, ‚ÄúNew directory‚Äù find prodigenr project list. project, can add manuscript/report Quarto file using: main secondary function template_list command, lists available template files: detailed tutorial, see introduction vignette:

title: Research Project Directory Generator
text: several existing packages creating projects, ‚Äôs pros cons. Check last section vignette("prodigenr") details. Try see like! prodigenr tries use ideas R packages/devtools still simple possible specific academic researchers primarily biomedical/non-computer science fields. However, can always improve! welcome suggestions, just submit GitHub issue.

prodigenr 0.7.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-12-13

title: prodigenr 0.7.0
text: New projects Git added beginning, don‚Äôt need use setup_with_git() (#148). rmarkdown::draft() can‚Äôt Quarto docs template/ folders, instead move generic Quarto template files. Rename doc/ docs/ basic analysis project folder. match semantics docs/ folder usually one document (#149). isn‚Äôt always useful report created project setup, adding report via create_report() removed project_setup() (#142). Use Quarto instead R Markdown template files (#150).

title: prodigenr 0.7.0
text: creating new .gitignore, include .quarto .DS_Store files (#141) well .Rbuildignore files (#143). New projects .Rproj set options usethis::use_blank_slate("project") (#144). Move gert imports, since makes sense hard dependency project opinionated project creator (#145).

title: prodigenr 0.7.0
text: title field DESCRIPTION file needed many usethis functions, added created DESCRIPTION file (#137).

title: prodigenr 0.6.2
text: CRAN release: 2022-08-29

title: prodigenr 0.6.2
text: Removed Distill imports created report, switching using Quarto instead (e.g.¬†YAML metadata). Removed AppVeyor. Rearranged project creation copy internal folder (necessary files) specified folder users computer. hopefully make easier add templates later . Updated package aims clearer focused. Fixes CRAN notes HTML5.

title: prodigenr 0.6.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-06-02

title: prodigenr 0.6.1
text: DESCRIPTION file actually needs Package field (#127).

title: prodigenr 0.6.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-05-12

title: prodigenr 0.6.0
text: Removed abstract poster templates. Abstracts small isn‚Äôt important addition (sense) posters created software tools (e.g.¬†PowerPoint). Plus aren‚Äôt many mature well-established poster packages R point time. Tidied trim README files include pointers prodigenr online documentation instead. Removed R script template files. Projects might diverse template scripts make sense. Removed several dependencies, including usethis package. Moved Git initialization setup new function called setup_with_git().

title: prodigenr 0.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-07-01

title: prodigenr 0.5.0
text: Switch one argument setup_project() called path (#102)

title: prodigenr 0.5.0
text: Can now use RStudio‚Äôs ‚ÄúNew Project‚Äù interface GUI creation project (#109, #111) Setup projects ‚Äúblank slates‚Äù (.e.¬†don‚Äôt save .RData) (#105) Add TODO list project complete project creation (#39)

title: prodigenr 0.5.0
text: Fix NOTES CRAN results check unused dependencies (clipr, desc, devtools)

title: prodigenr 0.5.0
text: Remove deprecated prodigen() function (#107) Replace current interactive messaging usethis::ui_* functions Reduced opinionated content moved rostools manifesto (#108) Removed dependencies using functions usethis Incorporate use_template() instead custom function (#101)

title: prodigenr 0.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2018-05-23

title: prodigenr 0.4.0
text: Use R Markdown template files draft posters, slides, manuscripts, abstract (#70, #75). See create_* type commands. New function setup general project, excluding individual document types manuscript, slides, etc (#72). prodigen function deprecated. READMEs folder section fill main README project description (#38, #80).

title: prodigenr 0.4.0
text: Moved include_*() functions rostools (#96)

title: prodigenr 0.4.0
text: Added additional information template README.md (#29, #30, #32)

title: prodigenr 0.4.0
text: TODO items created README Added code coverage #65

text: CRAN release: 2016-07-29

title: prodigenr 0.3.0
text: prodigen() now creates new project structure mimics R package development , specifically devtools (since well documented actively maintained) (#18, #15, #14). old style removed. Added function include STROBE checklist reporting guidelines (#21). Added function include rfigshare script send figshare (#19). Added function include complete MIT license (#20).
